document_title: Benign kidney tumors: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: u-than-lanh-tinh.json_3_Signs of benign tumors in the kidney
subsection_content:
Depending on the location of the benign tumor, the patient will have specific symptoms or not. Even in many cases, benign kidney tumors are not detected because the patient does not have any symptoms. But in general, signs of a benign kidney tumor include:
Hypertension: This is one of the typical symptoms of benign kidney tumors. Patients with high blood pressure, sudden and dangerous to their health.; Abnormal increase in heart rate: In many cases, it increases to 180 beats/minute; Skin color is pale, pale, tired, weak, weight loss; Headache whose cause cannot be found; Nausea, difficulty breathing, chills, or sweating; Have digestive problems such as constipation; Insecure, worried, restless mood
Most cases of benign kidney tumors have no symptoms, but specific groups such as pregnant women, manual workers... will have more serious and easily recognizable symptoms.
